I don't think so, because it would still send no-cache and no-store, which (according to the docs) forces the cache to submit to the origin server for revalidation.
I just tested this via compose, and with DJANGO_API_CACHE_ENABLED=false in the environment, all my requests to the action implementation view have X-Cache: MISS in the headers. Without it, they all have X-Cache: HIT.
